title: Application Development Engineer, Visualization and Data Solutions (VDS)
description:
**Job Description**

**Application Development Engineer, Visualization and Data Solutions (VDS)**


As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.


At Thermo Fisher Scientific, Diversity & Inclusion is crucial to the future success of our organization. It is not just something we do, it is who we are. It enables our colleagues to openly share the wide range of perspectives they represent, creating an environment where differences are truly valued, authenticity is a state-of-being, and everyone feels they belong and can do their best work!

**Location/Division Specific Information**


The Visualization and Data Solutions Business Unit (VDS BU) provides analytical digital solutions to accelerate innovation and productivity across research and industrial laboratories. This includes advanced visualization and analysis software for understanding 2D-5D bioimaging sample and materials structures and properties; 3D visualization and image analysis toolkit and collaborative imaging data management platform for traceability of image-based scientific experiments.


The position is in our Eindhoven office in the Netherlands. You will report to Jérôme Hummel, director Product Management.

**How you will make an Impact?**


As an Application Development Engineer, the expansiveness of your role will allow you to play a pivotal part in working on ground-breaking technology for devices that make the world a healthier, cleaner, and safer place. In this role you will have an opportunity to collaborate with other teams such as R&D, Product Marketing, and sales as well as scientists to build something from inception to first customer shipment. Development is done in multi-disciplinary teams across multiple sites. This role provides the opportunity to grow within the product management team as a domain authority or people leader as well as across the Thermo Fisher organization. Furthermore, you will build a network with internal and external community of specific scientific domains such as e.g. Semiconductors, Life Science or Material Science through collaborations with early and leading customers and help shape the future of advanced methods by your direct contribution to the development of new software solutions.

**What will you do?**


Collaborate and network extensively with external customers (including end users and engineering project companies), and internal partners, including: Commercial team, Marketing team, Senior Management, Project Managers and Engineers, Customers & industry representatives to develop new solutions in the semiconductor, materials science and life science domain!


And furthermore:

* Support R&D, product development and product marketing by lending applications expertise.
* Beta test the VDS portfolio and provide feedback for improved usability and quality.
* Write detailed specifications for a given solution, prototype it and iterate on best ways to move forward.
* Perform demonstrations on pre-release products.
* Develop tutorials, proof of concept, examples, and use-cases.
* Conduct investigations/collaborations on promising new technologies
* Deliver marketing and sales collateral to the Product Marketing group for incorporation into collaterals.

**How will you get here?**


This position is ideal for an experienced computer scientist with strong expertise in image processing and data analysis. Skills in visualization and materials characterization or EM pre or post processing techniques is a plus.

**Qualification?**


Master’s degree or equivalent in computer science with experience in image processing techniques.

**Experience, knowledge, skills, abilities:**

* Highly desirable to have any or all of the following: scientific background with strong software culture; innovation and design thinking; software product management and software development lifecycle
* Ability to collect and align requirements from user perspectives.
* Strategy oriented, problem solver
* Image processing expert with validated track of record and knowledge in image analysis software such as Avizo
* Software development skills needed including C++ and/or Python
* Experience interacting with new users and highly technical customers and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to a variety of audiences.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a diverse audience.
* Ability to independently identify, define and implement solutions
* Ability to identity opportunities (e.g., for collaborations that support product strategy)
* Ability to own and lead projects.
* Thrives in a dynamic team and enjoys being exposed to a constant variety of complex issues that need to be resolved.


Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain **5 reasons to work with us**. As one team of 130,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. **#StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific**, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.


Does this sound like something you are interested in?

**Apply today!** **http://jobs.thermofisher.com**


Applications will be reviewed constantly and the position will be filled once we find the suitable team member.

*Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.*
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Creative data analyst for Collections
description:
**Will you help us improve our services for customers in financial difficulties through the smart use of data? Do you want to contribute to reducing the debt problem in the Netherlands? Are you passionate about making impact, based on data-driven insights? Do you enjoy solving problems and do you also want to have an impact on society by doing so? Then we are looking for you!**


You, as an amazing Data Analyst, will help us realize our ambition of being mobile first, frictionless, relevant and strive to prevent debt a data-driven way.


This and more can be achieved whilst working in multi-disciplinary teams consisting of customer journey experts, other data analysts, data scientists and our operational colleagues.

**What do we stand for within Collections?**


Collections NL wants to make a difference by being the partner of customers in financial difficulties. We offer our customers 'personal, easy, smart' and customer-centric solutions with the help of advanced analytics. By doing so we want to prevent customers from getting into financial hardship (prevention) and to help those with ING product-related debts in a sustainable fashion.


Even when it comes to debt recovery, more and more customers want to be able to handle everything independently and digitally, while looking for personal and relevant advice when it comes to complex financial issues or problems. Therefore we are improving our customer journeys on a daily basis in order to better serve our customers and more effectively. By doing so we contribute to a sustainable financially fit Netherlands.

**What does Collections do?**

* Not to sound cliché, but, no day is the same at the innovative Collections department as can be illustrated by some of the topics we are currently working on:
* Understanding the reasons of financial difficulties
* Assisting in developing a chatbot/call bot
* Analysing call reasons to better route and help customers
* Segmentation and analysis of the probability to default models
* Predictive models to be able to detect debt and possibly nudge preventively
* Digitization initiatives to improve the customer experience within self-service routes
* Data-driven approach in measuring the effectiveness all used tools for debt recovery
* Collaborations with the AFM, Credit risk management, Nederlandse Schuldhulproute and also other ING countries acting on our social responsibility as an institution, striving for sustainable debt prevention and recovery

**The team**


We are 5 data analysts who have a crucial and decisive role within the tribe, where we are responsible for maximizing the impact of Collections based on data-driven decisions and proactive analyses and advice. Think about analyses such as the efficiency of debt collection within NL compared to other countries, what we can learn from others?


What tools or measures can we use to get and keep customers out of arrears?


Feel free to reach out for more info on the team!

 **Roles and responsibilities**

* You know that success is a team effort
* You have an ambitious pro-active and positive mentality
* You generate, analyse and present relevant customer insights and enable per
* Standard reports are entrusted to our data warehouse team who made our data mart. They also build the reports in Cognos, so you can primarily focus on analysis!

**Your competencies**

* A master’s degree in the field of analytics, mathematics, econometrics or other analytical studies
* Creative mind with demonstrable experience in gaining insights from data
* Bridgebuilder: spread your love for data and translate the insights into actions for your stakeholders
* Couple years of demonstrable experience with data analysis via e.g. SQL , SAS, Excel, Cognos, R, Python
* You like to participate in fun activities with the team and department
* You like to continuously develop yourself
* You take initiative but you value cooperation just as much

**Rewards & benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster

**Interested?**


Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING . Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Senior Applications Engineer
description:
**Introduction**
----------------

Applications Engineering – Creating Tomorrow’s Value: We pro-actively enable business development and drive customer adoption of a tailored portfolio of sustainable ASML solutions by applying our industry product and process knowledge in a collaborative learning environment.


In the Mature Products and Services (MPS) business line we support customer requirements on 200mm wafers and below. Whether the solution is a PAS or Twinscan we find the best integrated solution to meet the Mature Market requirements. Our knowledge extends beyond traditional Semiconductors and extends to Thin Film Heads, uLEDs, Wide Band Gap technology, Augmented Reality, Bulk Acoustic Waves and many more.


**Roles and responsibilities**
------------------------------

* Maintain knowledge of critical information for ASML's systems, customer's product process, and usage to sustain MPS business.
* Drive revenue growth for MPS BL by creating and implementing new services that enhance customer's process window, productivity and yield.
* Solve ASML CSE's and Customer's complex issues by using knowledge of the interaction between systems and customer's process.
* Identify and justify added value of ASML's solution leading to the sale of tools, options and services for existing and potential MPS Customers.
* Conduct data analysis to ensure that the correct conclusions are drawn from customers acquired experimental data and results reported to ASML and customer.
* Meet with internal and external customers to maintain two-way level of commitment to keep all involved and affected parties informed of progress.
* Prepare technical presentations for customer meetings.

**Education and experience**
----------------------------

* Master's degree in a technical discipline with a minimum 5 years’ work experience or Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline with a minimum of 10 years' work experience.
* Minimum 2 years’ experience in data analysis using support software (MATLAB or Python or R or Excel)
* Minimum 3 years’ experience with stakeholder and change management.
* Minimum 1 year experience in data analysis and analyzing technical data to summarize and present findings.
* Minimum 1 year experience with project management methodologies.

**Skills**
----------

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is Public always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems. To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:


* Must have strong organizational, communication, leadership and interpersonal skills.
* Detailed oriented individuals with strong critical thinking, problem solving and follow-up skills.
* Fast learner with strong self-motivation to grow technically; be able to perform job at high standard with minimum supervision and demonstrated ability to thrive in a high pressure and fast paced environment.
* Ability to prioritize and organize actions effectively and efficiently.
* Basic project management skills.
* Self-starter that shows high drive, creativity, ambition and accountability.
* Strong communication skills to collaborate with different stakeholders internally (Account Team, Business Development Managers, Project team, VHV headquarter, etc.) and external customers.

**Other information**
---------------------

* Up to 25% travel dependent on business need.
* Veldhoven, Netherlands is the preferred location, but other ASML locations in Europe can be considered.

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: (Junior) Scientist Bioinformatics
description:
**Your job in a nutshell**
--------------------------


As a **(Junior) Scientist in Bioinformatics**, you will contribute to designing and executing all the data analysis, computational, and modeling steps required to discover new molecular signatures and translate them into clinically relevant and commercially viable molecular assays, for diagnosis, prognosis, and drug effectiveness prediction.


You will be working with internationally renowned academic partners and SkylineDx’ multidisciplinary development team.


Currently, we have a great team of close to 50 people in the Netherlands and 20 people working in the US. You will be responsible for helping us support this exceptional group of people and make future growth possible.


Together, we ensure the translation of clinically relevant scientific discoveries into reliable medical diagnostic assays for diagnosis, prognosis, and drug effectiveness prediction that will ultimately contribute to improved patient care.


You will perform your work from our Rotterdam office (hybrid work model) and report to the Director of Bioinformatics.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
-----------------------------------------


* Contribute to the assay development trajectory that encompasses early discovery research, feasibility studies, and, in support of product development, analytical and clinical validation, preparation of assay registration files, scientific publications, and presentations.
* Develop machine learning and AI algorithms and methodologies, whenever off-the-shelf solutions are not available to address the problem at hand.
* Contribute to identifying new business opportunities and develop new statistics.

**You have**
------------


* a master’s degree in bioinformatics, or related quantitative disciplines (candidates with a recent PhD and equivalent work experience will also be considered).
* a solid knowledge of statistics.
* the ability to understand and design (new) machine learning and AI algorithms.
* coding skills in R, Python, bash.
* an excellent command of written and spoken English.
* experience with oncology and NGS data analysis (preferred).
* basic understanding of survival analyses (preferred).
* experience in high throughput assay design and analysis (preferred).
* strong analytical mindset and creative approach to problem-solving.
* a service and result-oriented attitude.
* a hands-on mentality.
* an entrepreneurial mindset and can work in an environment with high-quality standards.
* the ability to work in a team with internal and external collaborators.
* affinity with our corporate quotes (must).

**We offer**
------------


* a full-time position, a hybrid work model, a market competitive salary and market competitive secondary conditions of employment.
* opportunities for personal growth.
* the best of two worlds: a career in life sciences at an innovative biotech company with the emphasis on clinical diagnostics in close collaboration with an academic environment.
* the ability to serve society with science-based solutions.

**At SkylineDx**
----------------


We live to make a difference. It is our mission to improve a patient’s quality of life by enabling them to benefit from personal insights at the genomic level of their disease. That means we are continuously innovating the world of gene signature-based diagnostic testing. That also means we have a unique blend of characteristics. We have our soft side. Our culture is oftentimes described as familial, warm, loyal and highly engaged. We have our rational side where exact sciences are driving our mission. And when needed our passionate side surfaces to clear the way so we can serve society with science-based solutions.


**Our quotes**
--------------


#serviceisjoy


#valueformoney


#playtogethertowin


#amazingthingshappen


#cogitoergosum


#itsyourparty


**Do apply!**
-------------


Send your resume and motivation letter to [email protected]. If you have questions or want more information, don’t hesitate to contact us. You’ll find the contact details on our website. We will make sure it lands on the right desk! Refer to our Privacy policy on our website for information about the processing of your personal data.

title: Postdoc on Computational and Statistical Analysis of Genomics Data
description:
Research at the Clinical Infectiology (KLIF) section focuses on zoonotic, parasitic and foodborne pathogens and the emergence of antimicrobial resistance. The generation and analysis of sequencing data is part of our daily work for epidemiology, virulence and antimicrobial resistance determination, to assess the effects of interventions, and for diagnostics. KLIF offers an international and stimulating work environment at the forefront of scientific research. You will actively participate in our scientific meetings and publish the findings in peer reviewed scientific journals.


**Your job**
------------


As a postdoc, you will be responsible for addressing the data analysis challenges arising from the latest advances in high-throughput sequencing technologies, including the analysis of microbiome and resistome data (amplicon, shotgun sequencing and longitudinal experiments), whole genome or single cell sequencing data. You will work together with project leaders and PhD candidates to answer research questions on transmission of pathogens, the effects of antimicrobial treatments on the microbiome and for assessing the microbiome and resistome for both epidemiological analyses and for diagnostics. You will thrive in a unique multi-disciplinary environment including veterinarians, biologists, and bioinformaticians, with an opportunity to supervise Master's students and contribute to teaching and hands-on multiple day workshops.


**Your qualities**
------------------


You will be encouraged to communicate complex scientific concepts in clear, accessible language, honing your presentation skills along the way. Additionally, you will have the platform to showcase your exceptional scientific writing abilities, as fluency in English is essential. We expect you to have:


* a PhD degree in Microbiology, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Statistical Genomics, Epidemiology or a related discipline;
* affinity with microbiology, genomics and an understanding of microbiome research;
* experience in biostatistical analysis and data interpretation for large data sets;
* experience in R, Python or similar programming languages;
* experience in integrating complex/omics data sets by translating the required handling into custom made programs.


**Our offer**
-------------


We offer an exciting opportunity for individuals passionate about microbiology and eager to contribute to cutting-edge microbiome and microbial genomics research. Join us and be part of our dynamic community while refining your professional skills in a supportive and collaborative setting. Furthermore, we offer:


* an employment contract for a duration of one year with 0.7-1.0 full-time equivalent (FTE) research time, optionally supplemented with 0.1 or 0.2 FTE teaching time (thus totaling 0.7 to 1.0 FTE). In case of a good performance, extending the employment is well within the range of possibilities;
* a working week of 28 to 40 hours with a gross monthly salary ranging from €3,226 to €5,090 for a full-time position (scale 10 of the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities);
* 8% holiday pay and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%;
* a pension scheme, partially paid parental leave, and flexible employment conditions based on the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities.


In addition to the terms of employment laid down in the CAO NU, Utrecht University has a number of schemes and facilities of its own for employees. This includes schemes facilitating professional development, leave schemes and schemes for sports and cultural activities, as well as discounts on software and other IT products. We also offer access to additional employee benefits through our Terms of Employment Options Model. In this way, we encourage our employees to continue to invest in their growth. For more information, please visit Working at Utrecht University.


**About us**
------------


A better future for everyone. This ambition motivates our scientists in executing their leading research and inspiring teaching. At Utrecht University, the various disciplines collaborate intensively towards major strategic themes. Our focus is on Dynamics of Youth, Institutions for Open Societies, Life Sciences and Pathways to Sustainability. Sharing science, shaping tomorrow.


At the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine we train the veterinarians and researchers of the future, provide care for animals and conduct leading and societal relevant research. That is what we are good at. We see that the health and welfare of animals, humans and the environment are interconnected. By sharing our knowledge and working together, we make positive impact, both nationally and internationally. Our 1,500 students and 950 employees inspire and strengthen each other. Our engagement connects us. The drive to, from an integral perspective, make the world a better place.


The Division of Infectious Diseases and Immunology is renowned for its expertise in the field of clinical veterinary infectiology and molecular resistance and is part of the Department of Biomolecular Health Sciences. The division also trains European Board specialists in Veterinary Microbiology. To conduct its core activities, the group has laboratories for clinical microbiological diagnostics and research. This Division is entrusted with teaching and conducting applied research in the fields of biology and the prevention of infectious diseases and diseases of the immune system.


At Clinical Infectiology (KLIF), we do not only work with academic partners, but also with global organisations like the World Health Organisation, the World Organisation for Animal Health, and the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations, holding reference centres on antimicrobial resistance and/or Campylobacter, but also as consultants.


**More information**
--------------------


For more information, please contact Dr Aldert Zomer at a.l.zomer@uu.nl or Professor Jaap Wagenaar at j.wagenaar@uu.nl.


Candidates for this vacancy will be recruited by Utrecht University.


**Apply now**
-------------


As Utrecht University, we want to be a home for everyone. We value staff with diverse backgrounds, perspectives and identities, including cultural, religious or ethnic background, gender, sexual orientation, disability or age. We strive to create a safe and inclusive environment in which everyone can flourish and contribute.


To apply, please send your curriculum vitae, including a letter of motivation, via the ‘apply now’ button.

title: Analytics Engineer L5, Title & Launch Management - EMEA
description:
Amsterdam, Netherlands
Data Science and Engineering
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with over 247 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across various genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and change their plans anytime.  

  

The goal of our Title & Launch Management Data Science and Engineering team is to enable operational and creative excellence in the distribution and promotion of our content. We collaborate closely with our partners in the Product Discovery & Promotion organization, and our work directly contributes to launching high-quality content on our service and helping our members discover content they will love. We conduct analyses, develop models, and build analytical tools to help our partners execute on these primary objectives.  

  

Europe is a significant center for our Studio and Creative Production teams. We are looking for a talented analytics engineer–to be based in our Amsterdam office–to join our growing European-based team. In this role, you would support the launch of our content and its discovery on our service, and become a trusted partner for regional Studio & Creative Production leadership. You will design and develop analytical products and insights that will power content launch operations at scale, while partnering with our world-class team of creative production practitioners and various cross-functional teams.  

Interested? Read more about the job description and qualifications below!**As a Senior Analytics Engineer in this space, you will:**
-----------------------------------------------------------

* Be a strategic partner for Creative Production teams: identify critical analytical problems and apply an entrepreneurial mindset to find innovative solutions with data.
* Drive the direction of your work, developing solutions that span from scrappy code and prototype tools to high-visibility dashboards and analyses for Creative Production leadership.
* Spearhead the creation of new metrics that impact decision-making across Creative Production.
* Collaborate with Data Engineers to source data from new systems and strengthen our foundational data models.
* Become a regional expert on all things Studio & Creative Production Data Science & Engineering, helping educate and connect regional offices to existing data solutions.
**You are:**
------------

* A strong communicator who can develop and deepen strong relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders. You have experience partnering closely with executive leadership, with a proven track record of influencing strategic decisions through data.
* Comfortable with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process. You connect the dots across business needs and independently drive projects forward.
* A senior analytics professional with extensive experience across data wrangling, analysis, reporting, and visualization.
* An expert in a data-oriented programming language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Scala, etc.) and intuitive dashboard/visualization design (e.g. Tableau).
* Proficient in ETL and data warehousing best practices and core statistics concepts (e.g., estimation, hypothesis testing)
* Adept at working across different cultures on a globally distributed team, with core working hours in the Central European and GMT time zones.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.
company_addresses:
121 Albright Way
Los Gatos, CA 95032, USA
company_description: Netflix is a streaming service that offers a wide variety of award-winning TV shows, movies, anime, documentaries and more – on thousands of internet-connected devices.

title: Forward Deployed Engineer
description:
**About MotherDuck**
====================


Don’t let the quirky name fool you! We’re on a mission to radically transform the data analyst user experience. We think we can empower and delight analysts using a novel cloud architecture built on top of DuckDB, an open source foundation with a vibrant community. We’re rapidly driving towards general availability and need your help to create many “aha moments” for our users. Our team is a diverse mix of passionate, collaborative and empathetic data industry veterans from Google, Amazon, Meta, Snowflake, SingleStore, Databricks, and the like.

**Core Responsibilities**
=========================


As a Forward Deployed Engineer at MotherDuck, you are tasked with making MotherDuck users successful. You strive to deeply understand customer needs, you collaborate with product and engineering teams to improve the product, you propose creative bespoke solutions, you work with customers on implementation, and you synthesize learnings.


You are a seasoned engineer at heart, able to execute on engineering initiatives independently. You are an exceptional communicator and problem solver. Importantly, you are a creative generalist comfortable in ambiguity, and you enjoy working closely and iteratively with customers, engineers, product managers, and designers.

**Requirements**
================

* Solid understanding and direct experience working with analytics databases, BI tools, and data processing tools
* Expert knowledge of SQL
* Expert understanding of various data management architectures, such as OLAP, OLTP, data lake, and HTAP
* Experience working with connectors and drivers for databases, such as JDBC, ODBC, and SQLAlchemy
* Experience working in a highly technical outbound engineering role
* Experience building technical customer solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Confidence in working with customers to architect and troubleshoot solutions
* Comfortable with a high level of ambiguity and able to execute independently

**Nice to haves, but** ***definitely*** **not deal breakers**
=============================================================

* Experience with Python and dbt
* Experience with building outbound engineering or technical sales organizations
* Experience building data tool connectors
* Knowledge of data file format internals Parquet, etc.
* Practical experience building data pipelines end-to-end

**What we provide**
===================

* Competitive compensation and stock options
* For US-based employees:


	+ 100% paid medical, dental, and vision for employees
	+ 80% paid medical, dental, and vision for dependen*ts*
* For Non-US based employees:


	+ You probably have a functioning health system and social safety net so healthcare is not a major factor in employment. If that is not the case let us know and we’ll work something out.
* Unlimited Paid Time Off
* 401k plan
* Regular offsites in hub or exotic locations
* Geographically distributed team with hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, New York City, & Amsterdam

**Please Apply**
================


Does this role sound appealing to you, but you’re missing some of the requirements or don’t quite think you’re qualified? Please apply anyway. Research has shown that underrepresented groups in technology often shy away from roles which aren’t a 100% match. We aim to build a diverse team and will strongly consider applicants who bring many of the requirements plus have other experiences which round out their qualifications.


MotherDuck is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. MotherDuck is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.


Compensation Range: $140K - $275K

title: Data Team Lead
description:
#### **Your mission**


We're currently seeking a talented individual to join us as a Data Team Lead. In this pivotal role, you'll be instrumental in guiding our team of industrial ecologists, data analysts, and quantitative researchers towards impactful outcomes in the field of circular economy and sustainability.

 **Team Leadership**

* Lead and manage a team of 3-7 industrial ecologists, data analysts and quantitative researchers.
* Provide coaching to and build the capacity and learning trajectories for your team.
* Create a work environment and data culture for your team to flourish.

 **Content Management**

* Keep up to date with the latest research, methodologies and reporting requirements in the field of circular economy and related, and ensure your team is up to date too.
* Collaborate with the team on the development and implementation of new methodologies
* Implement proactive quality management plans across multiple projects and within the organisation. Track performance to identify root causes of issues and implement remedial actions. Serve as the escalation point for unresolved data issues
* Maintain a data workflow that spans the various quantitative approaches applied

 **Delivery Management**

* Meet with Project Managers on a regular basis to ensure milestones are met and high quality outputs are delivered, and to ensure appropriate resources are assigned to meet project deliverables
* Support the development of a data culture, nurture strong communications with your team, functional leads, project managers and all other stakeholders
* Across projects, with clients and internal team members, manage process improvements, issue escalations, workloads and provide technical expertise to junior team members
* Support the team in developing a strong data workflow

 **Client Relationships**

* Represent CE and your team at talks with clients and stakeholders, when necessary.
* Alongside a project lead, act as the primary point of contact with clients on data deliverables. Support negotiations with clients on defining data deliverables, suitable work plans and budgets.

#### **Your profile**

**Skills and Competencies**

* You are an experienced quantitative researcher or analyst with **5+ years of relevant experience**, with some commercial experience, and can demonstrate experience in the coaching and management of colleagues.
* You have a background in data and analysis, applied economics, applied econometrics more generally but demonstrated work experience and exposure to industrial ecology, sustainability analysis and reporting OR You have a background in industrial ecology, environmental engineering, ecological economics, or related domains with work experience in data management and analysis
* You can demonstrate some experience in managing projects, workflows and budgets, and in working with clients. You are eager to support the development of more junior researchers and analysts in this direction.
* You are familiar with Python and SQL, and data workflows/management
* You are practical and hands-on; the success of this role lies in its realised impact.
* You can demonstrate some knowledge about key methods of environmental analysis (e.g. Material Flow Analysis, Life Cycle Analysis and Input-Output Analysis)
* You can demonstrate some knowledge and understanding of upcoming legislation such as the EU Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD, CSDD, Taxonomy)
* You are able to work on and apply standards and frameworks such as SBTn, LEAP, GRI and/or CTI
* You have excellent written and spoken communication skills in English;

**Bonus:**

* Experience with machine learning approaches
* Experience with software or digital product development
* Knowledge of a variety of numerical modeling skills will be handy
* Experience contributing to academic or non-academic publications

#### **Why us?**


We are a team of 55+ driven and ambitious professionals, coming from diverse backgrounds and  

from more than 20 different countries, sharing the belief that the circular economy creates prosperity for all.  

This is a full-time position (32-40 hours per week) based in the Netherlands, with our office conveniently located in central Amsterdam. Candidates should be prepared to work primarily from our office, contributing to our monumental work environment while enjoying the vibrant culture of this  

beautiful city.  

If you're passionate about driving positive change through data-driven solutions and are ready to  

take on a leadership role in a dynamic team, we'd love to hear from you. Join us in shaping a  

sustainable future through innovation and collaboration. Apply now to be part of our mission!  

**Applications will close on 1 June 2024 and we will interview people on a rolling basis.**

#### **About us**

**ABOUT CIRCLE ECONOMY**


Circle Economy is an impact organisation combining research, tools, and advice for the greater good. We were founded to create prosperity for all within the limits of our planet. With nature as our mentor, we accelerate circularity. We help businesses, cities, and nations with data-powered roadmaps for change. We are an international team of excited experts based in Amsterdam.

**PURPOSE**


Earth, our home, needs to be healthy, safe, and just for generations to come. We harness the world’s intelligence and collaborative drive to restore its balance. It can and must be done; we pave the way.

**VISION**


A circular economy meets the needs of people in harmony with nature. It designs out waste and pollution, keeps products and materials in use, and regenerates natural systems. It’s a balancing act with nature as our mentor.

**MISSION**


We are a global impact organisation with an international team of passionate experts based in Amsterdam. We empower businesses, cities and nations with practical and scaleable solutions to put the circular economy into action.


Our vision is an economic system that ensures that the planet and all people can thrive. To avoid climate breakdown, our goal is to double global circularity by 2032. We do this by creating:* An Impact-Driven Data and Evidence Base;
* Establishing metrics for assessing circularity that embraces ecological, economical, and social indicators
* Promoting circular solutions, innovations, and initiatives that have a positive impact on ecology, economy, and society


Actionable and Practical Strategies;

* Building capacity of stakeholders towards the implementation of circular strategies
* Ensuring multi-stakeholder commitment—operational, financial, and political—towards the implementation of circular strategies
* A Digital Environment to Scale Adoption;
* Standardising and digitising the scan approach into products and tools
* Facilitating access to tools and knowledge through open online platforms


OUR CULTURE  

We are an international team of ambitious and highly driven (young) professionals who share the belief that the circular economy creates prosperity for all. We work in a lively and dynamic atmosphere in our open office space right in the heart of Amsterdam. At Circle Economy, we have a friendly and open team dynamic and a culture of getting things done while having fun.  

  

Circle Economy welcomes applications from all qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status or pregnancy and maternity,as governed under our Gender Equality Plan. Circle Economy encourages our candidates to refrain from attaching their profile photos and gender details in their resumes to mitigate any potential subconscious bias.

title: Creative data analyst for Collections
description:
**Will you help us improve our services for customers in financial difficulties through the smart use of data? Do you want to contribute to reducing the debt problem in the Netherlands? Are you passionate about making impact, based on data-driven insights? Do you enjoy solving problems and do you also want to have an impact on society by doing so? Then we are looking for you!**


You, as an amazing Data Analyst, will help us realize our ambition of being mobile first, frictionless, relevant and strive to prevent debt a data-driven way.


This and more can be achieved whilst working in multi-disciplinary teams consisting of customer journey experts, other data analysts, data scientists and our operational colleagues.

**What do we stand for within Collections?**


Collections NL wants to make a difference by being the partner of customers in financial difficulties. We offer our customers 'personal, easy, smart' and customer-centric solutions with the help of advanced analytics. By doing so we want to prevent customers from getting into financial hardship (prevention) and to help those with ING product-related debts in a sustainable fashion.


Even when it comes to debt recovery, more and more customers want to be able to handle everything independently and digitally, while looking for personal and relevant advice when it comes to complex financial issues or problems. Therefore we are improving our customer journeys on a daily basis in order to better serve our customers and more effectively. By doing so we contribute to a sustainable financially fit Netherlands.

**What does Collections do?**

* Not to sound cliché, but, no day is the same at the innovative Collections department as can be illustrated by some of the topics we are currently working on:
* Understanding the reasons of financial difficulties
* Assisting in developing a chatbot/call bot
* Analysing call reasons to better route and help customers
* Segmentation and analysis of the probability to default models
* Predictive models to be able to detect debt and possibly nudge preventively
* Digitization initiatives to improve the customer experience within self-service routes
* Data-driven approach in measuring the effectiveness all used tools for debt recovery
* Collaborations with the AFM, Credit risk management, Nederlandse Schuldhulproute and also other ING countries acting on our social responsibility as an institution, striving for sustainable debt prevention and recovery

**The team**


We are 5 data analysts who have a crucial and decisive role within the tribe, where we are responsible for maximizing the impact of Collections based on data-driven decisions and proactive analyses and advice. Think about analyses such as the efficiency of debt collection within NL compared to other countries, what we can learn from others?


What tools or measures can we use to get and keep customers out of arrears?


Feel free to reach out for more info on the team!

 **Roles and responsibilities**

* You know that success is a team effort
* You have an ambitious pro-active and positive mentality
* You generate, analyse and present relevant customer insights and enable per
* Standard reports are entrusted to our data warehouse team who made our data mart. They also build the reports in Cognos, so you can primarily focus on analysis!

**Your competencies**

* A master’s degree in the field of analytics, mathematics, econometrics or other analytical studies
* Creative mind with demonstrable experience in gaining insights from data
* Bridgebuilder: spread your love for data and translate the insights into actions for your stakeholders
* Couple years of demonstrable experience with data analysis via e.g. SQL , SAS, Excel, Cognos, R, Python
* You like to participate in fun activities with the team and department
* You like to continuously develop yourself
* You take initiative but you value cooperation just as much

**Rewards & benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster

**Interested?**


Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING . Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job ID:** R0007552


**Date posted:** 15/05/2024


**About us**


Our vision, to create a better everyday life for the many people, influences everything we do. It’s a vision that lives in the everyday efforts of all co-workers, all over the world. Fulfilling the IKEA vision requires a strong, efficient and sustainable business setup. That's why it's built on a franchise system. The IKEA Franchisor, Inter IKEA Systems B.V., is the worldwide owner of the IKEA Concept, and has the responsibility to ensure that the IKEA Concept stays attractive and competitive while enabling growth and a profitable business for IKEA franchisees.


Take time to explore the IKEA Franchise system here, and read more about us.

**About the role**

**To strengthen our Digital Business Solution team, we are looking for Data Engineer’s in our Digital Product team for Business Performance (analytics)**.

**Things you can expect to do in this role, but not limited to:**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including business analysts, business representatives and data architect to understand the business and data requirements and develop data products to support analytics and business intelligence initiatives.
* Monitor and optimize the performance of data processing systems and infrastructure, identifying bottlenecks and implementing optimizations to improve efficiency and scalability.
* Document data pipelines, workflows, and system architectures, and provide knowledge sharing and training to enable other team members to understand and utilize data engineering tools and processes effectively.
* Assess business requirements for completeness and accuracy and determine if requirements are actionable for ETL (Extraction, Transformation and Load). Work with business/solution owners to close issues and gaps
* Lead the development and validation of data integration (ETL) pipelines needed to ingest/transform data to and from transactional systems and warehouses
* Develop communication content (e.g., release notes) in line with the business needs
* Be responsible for all aspects of integrating, and processing data, including associated data modelling.

**About you**

* You are curious to explore, eager to learn and energized by sharing. Your drive is to continuously improve the ways of working connected to the developments of our digital solutions. You also have a long-term vision in mind with any actions that you undertake, for example you see that workarounds are just a short-term fix.
* You want to help and support our co-workers to the best of your ability, while at the same time you’re able to balance when to say no and explain the “why”.
* You have the ability to motivate, lead and inspire people (directly and indirectly). You are IT savvy and enjoy working within IT environment. You have an interdependent leadership style and have excellent stake holders and change management skills.
* You analyse and communicate complex issues in a clear, engaging way with a down to earth, simple tone of voice. As such, you are able to build trustful relationships with stakeholders and business partners.

**Knowledge, capabilities and motivation**


As the ideal candidate we expect you to have minimum of 3 years of data integration experience and the following capabilities:

* Extensive knowledge of GIT as a source control system
* Experience working with Data Bricks & Spark
* Experience in ingesting raw files in cloud native data platform .
* Proficiency in authorization model Azure.
* Setting up authorisation and access control and making sure that the data pipelines are secured.
* Extensive Knowledge of SQL and Python
* Extensive experience working in agile project environments
* Experience in working with building data products on Azure using tools such as data bricks and synapse.
* Proficiency in building ETL pipelines from structured data sources and data warehousing and big data processing
* Extensive knowledge of Data Management concepts. Technical knowledge in database design, data models, and segmentation techniques
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to turn preliminary or ambiguous information, ideas, or problems into well-defined plans and solutions

  

**More Information** **A few more details for you**


This is a full-time role (40 hours per week) located in Delft, the Netherlands.


14th May 2024 is the closing date to apply for this role. **Please note: Only application including the****motivation letter and CV will be considered**. Please send your application – CV and motivation – in English and tell us why you would be a good fit. We look forward to hearing from you!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Internship Business Inventory Analyst
description:
**Job Description:**

**Exciting Internship Opportunity: Business Inventory Analyst Intern**
----------------------------------------------------------------------

**Mars is a family-owned company with over a century of history, creating products and offering services for people and pets. With sales nearing $35 billion, we are a global powerhouse producing some of the world's most beloved brands across 180 countries, including M&M's®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, and FREEDENT®.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**About the Internship**


Join our Insights & Analytics team as a Business Inventory Analyst Intern. In this role, you will collaborate with business analysts and data scientists, working with data and creating visualizations to provide actionable insights for the business.

**What We Are Looking For**

* **Problem-Solving Skills**: Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
* **Technical Skills**: Proficiency in Python for data acquisition and Power BI for data visualization.
* **Communication Skills**: Excellent English communication abilities.
* **Education**: Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree.
* **Thesis Opportunity**: Allocate 3 days to the internship team and 2 days for your own research/thesis work.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Analytics Support**: Assist business analysts with periodic and ad-hoc analytics.
* **Tool Development**: Contribute to the development and maintenance of structural tooling.

 **What You Can Expect from Mars**

* **Professional Growth**: Develop your talents and expand your knowledge in a major FMCG company renowned for its world-class brands.
* **Compensation**: Enjoy an attractive internship compensation package.
* **Work Environment**: Experience a dynamic, ambitious, and fun work environment.

  

Apply now to kickstart your career with Mars!


Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Data Quality Analyst
Data Quality Analyst
Commercial FP&A analyst - Internship (Finance)
description:
We (Fluke) are offering you a very challenging opportunity to join our talented EMEA Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team. You will provide key financial analysis for decision-making, to help grow our business. Next to handling some (daily & monthly) recurring tasks, there will be plenty of room to take initiative, learn, and grow.
  
Recurring activities
  
  

Daily activities are providing insight on bookings, shipments, rebates, margins, and outlook for the month. The standard tasks are mostly automated, but the dynamic nature of Fluke always poses changes and room for continuous improvement. Being part of our FP&A team, you will support our stakeholders with accurate analysis that helps in decision-making.
  
  

On a monthly basis, the team is focused on forecasting bookings, shipments, and margins, but also explaining the variances of the previous month and how they will impact the (near) future. Once everyone is aligned on the forecast, a very important task will be to load the data into our financial system.
  
  

Yearly, we work on some extensive projects, like the Plan for the upcoming year, rebate payouts, thorough margin analysis, and price adjustments.
  
  

There will also be opportunities to work on interesting and challenging projects e.g. creating new standard work (new processes) or producing interactive dashboards for current standard tasks.
  
  

Based on the above-mentioned recurring and ad hoc activities, we support to the business (therewith solving problems and answering queries), challenge ‘facts’, and seek opportunities to increase our sales and margin. A strong business understanding is key to grow in your role and to grow within the company.
  
Your Team
  
  

The EMEA FP&A team is an international and diverse group of currently 8 team players. We all have our specialties and focus areas but there is a lot of interaction and support between each other. We are dynamic and innovative, are used to working with deadlines, but also find the time to have fun. Personal Skills
  
  

**You have an analytical mindset:** you are curious to understand what drives certain evolutions and you are determined to get the correct answers.
  
  

You have an eagerness to learn!
  
  

You thrive for accuracy (but keep in mind a healthy balance between accuracy and pace).
  
  

You like to improve and automate processes.
  
  

You recognize structure in a very dynamic environment; you see the bigger picture and you’re able to connect the dots.
  
  

You are open-minded, comfortable providing suggestions, and customer-friendly.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

Enrolled in a Dutch university for the duration of the internship
  
  

Studying towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree in the area of Finance, Economics or related
  
  

Microsoft Excel skills are mandatory. Experience with Power BI, Hyperion, Oracle, and/or Python is preferred.
  
  

Proficiency in English.
  
  

Start from 1st of September
  
  

Fortive Corporation Overview
  
  

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.
  
  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.
  
  

We are a diverse team 18,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.
  
  

**Fortive:** For you, for us, for growth.
  
  

Ready to move your career forward? Find out more at careers.fortive.com . Fluke Corporation is the world leader in the manufacture, distribution and service of electronic test tools and software. We are a dynamic market leader with sound financial health. Fluke has achieved the number one or number two position in every market in which it competes. The Fluke brand has a reputation for portability, ruggedness, safety, ease of use and rigid standards of quality. A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation ( www.fortive.com ), Fluke is a multi-national corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented. It is driven by the phenomenally successful Fortive Business System. Working at Fluke gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging, “stretch” opportunities
company_description: An extraordinary company for people who create and execute vital, technology-based solutions to solve the world's most critical challenges.

title: Quantitative Analyst
Senior Data Scientist, Group Digital, INGKA GROUP
description:
**Job ID:** 239249


**Date posted:** 14/05/2024


**What you'll be doing day to day**  

  

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to help us define and build the personalization platform at IKEA. Our goal is to empower product teams to improve their products and customer experience through personalization, leveraged by machine learning.  

  

You will be part of the full product development process, from understanding the problem, through designing the solution by quick prototyping, then delivering and running our services in production.  

  

Facilitate and drive collaboration with engineers, data analysts, data scientists, product managers and other partners to explore and tackle exciting user-centric data problems. Provide direction and guidance to the teams on machine learning, research and experimentation, while balancing the long-term vision with a pragmatic approach.  

  

As a senior data scientist, you strive to discover value and excel in changing environments. You are excited about machine learning, analysis of user behavior, modern technologies (generative AI, deep learning, cloud-native, global scale), and innovative ways of working (cross-functional, autonomous, agility, DevOps-minded). You want to be part of shaping the future of personalization at IKEA - to dream big, build small and think smartly!  

  

**Your responsibilities**  

  

Proven experience with data science and machine learning, cloud systems knowledge, analysis of large datasets and experimentation.  

  

Proficiency in a programming language. If you’re interested in our current tech stack - the backend is Python, using a FastAPI framework. Data pipelines are orchestrated with Airflow and Vertex AI. Our application is hosted on GCP, using Docker and infra as code in Terraform. Our models and personalization API are run as microservices that communicate via Google RPC (gRPC) protocol.  

  

Being accountable for delivering quality software reliably, safely, and quickly into production, whilst understanding the customer impact and experience of your contribution.  

  

Sharing knowledge, promoting standard methodologies, keeping track of cutting-edge technologies and proposing the right ones to the team. Making your team the best version of itself through mentorship and constructive accountability.  

  

**Together as a team**  

  

In our team we love puzzles and are always looking for ways to make things smarter, safer and more user-friendly. We all come from different backgrounds and together we enable efficient product development and production through innovative engineering. Of course we also make sure that our products live up to the highest standards of quality, design, function, price and sustainability.  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

If you haveany questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to tech recruiter Annette Björkquist at annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ingka.ikea.com.  

  

We screen candidates continuously and therefore the ad might close earlier if we find the right candidate, please apply as soon as possible.  

  

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they’re 100% “qualified”. If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we like you to reconsider and give it a chance.
  

  

Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application.  

  

From: “Why Women Don’t Apply for Jobs Unless They’re 100% Qualified” by Tara Sophia Mohr, August 2014
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Cybersecurity Analyst
description:
**What We Do**  

Managing cyber risk, together.  

Forescout delivers automated cybersecurity across the digital terrain. We empower our customers to achieve continuous alignment of their security frameworks with their digital realities, across all asset types – IT, IoT, OT, and IoMT. It is a non-stop journey, managing cyber risk through automation and data-powered insights..**What You Will Do**  

You’ll be working as Cybersecurity Analyst. Your cybersecurity knowledge and software development skills enable you to join our multicultural, creative, and fast-paced team in Eindhoven to increase the device classification and vulnerability matching capabilities of our platform. If you are constantly hungry for new challenges and improvement and strive in an international environment, this is the job for you!  

**Responsibilities and tasks:*** Analyze customer data to identify gaps and areas of improvement in device classification and in the applicable device vulnerabilities.
* Proactively research vendor-specific device information to enrich our vulnerabilities and device classification content.
* Develop enhanced support for device classification and vulnerability matching as part of the Forescout Platform content updates.
* Collaborate with protocol analysts and software engineers to continuously improve and streamline classification and vulnerability enrichment processes.
* Document, test and validate the implemented solutions alongside your fellow engineering colleagues.

**What You offer Forescout*** Bachelor or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
* Proven knowledge of cyber security and networking concepts and protocols.
* Practical knowledge of scripting languages such as Lua, Bash, Python.
* Experience with Git source code management.
* Experience with cloud analytical applications and technologies (e.g Grafana).
* Previous experience with IoT, OT or IoMT/Medical Device software and technologies is a plus.

**Personal Skills*** Motivated, humble and willing to learn new technologies and eager to apply them to improve day-to-day productivity and code quality.
* Team player, keen to work collaboratively with others and share knowledge.
* Highly inquisitive and analytical mindset, with an ability to see both the big picture and the details.
* Able and willing to interact with internal and external (customer) stakeholders to obtain the information required and present results.
* Fluent in spoken and written English.


We encourage you to apply if you meet most but not all the desired skills and experience listed in this job posting. We value competencies, aptitude, and a great attitude as supplement to experience.**What Forescout Offers You*** Competitive compensation and benefits – generous PTO policy, and much more.
* Hybrid working model combining working at the office and from home.
* Collaborative and innovative environment – make an impact on worldwide security while working on the hottest technology.
* Leadership that supports and encourages professional growth and development.
* Want a glimpse of Life @ Forescout? Check us out on Facebook and Instagram.
* Learn more at www.forescout.com


Forescout Technologies is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We value and embrace diversity, equality, inclusion, and collaboration at the core of our “One Team” philosophy.

#LI-AO1

title: Forward Deployed Engineer
description:
**About MotherDuck**
====================


Don’t let the quirky name fool you! We’re on a mission to radically transform the data analyst user experience. We think we can empower and delight analysts using a novel cloud architecture built on top of DuckDB, an open source foundation with a vibrant community. We’re rapidly driving towards general availability and need your help to create many “aha moments” for our users. Our team is a diverse mix of passionate, collaborative and empathetic data industry veterans from Google, Amazon, Meta, Snowflake, SingleStore, Databricks, and the like.

**Core Responsibilities**
=========================


As a Forward Deployed Engineer at MotherDuck, you are tasked with making MotherDuck users successful. You strive to deeply understand customer needs, you collaborate with product and engineering teams to improve the product, you propose creative bespoke solutions, you work with customers on implementation, and you synthesize learnings.


You are a seasoned engineer at heart, able to execute on engineering initiatives independently. You are an exceptional communicator and problem solver. Importantly, you are a creative generalist comfortable in ambiguity, and you enjoy working closely and iteratively with customers, engineers, product managers, and designers.

**Requirements**
================

* Solid understanding and direct experience working with analytics databases, BI tools, and data processing tools
* Expert knowledge of SQL
* Expert understanding of various data management architectures, such as OLAP, OLTP, data lake, and HTAP
* Experience working with connectors and drivers for databases, such as JDBC, ODBC, and SQLAlchemy
* Experience working in a highly technical outbound engineering role
* Experience building technical customer solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Confidence in working with customers to architect and troubleshoot solutions
* Comfortable with a high level of ambiguity and able to execute independently

**Nice to haves, but** ***definitely*** **not deal breakers**
=============================================================

* Experience with Python and dbt
* Experience with building outbound engineering or technical sales organizations
* Experience building data tool connectors
* Knowledge of data file format internals Parquet, etc.
* Practical experience building data pipelines end-to-end

**What we provide**
===================

* Competitive compensation and stock options
* For US-based employees:


	+ 100% paid medical, dental, and vision for employees
	+ 80% paid medical, dental, and vision for dependen*ts*
* For Non-US based employees:


	+ You probably have a functioning health system and social safety net so healthcare is not a major factor in employment. If that is not the case let us know and we’ll work something out.
* Unlimited Paid Time Off
* 401k plan
* Regular offsites in hub or exotic locations
* Geographically distributed team with hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, New York City, & Amsterdam

**Please Apply**
================


Does this role sound appealing to you, but you’re missing some of the requirements or don’t quite think you’re qualified? Please apply anyway. Research has shown that underrepresented groups in technology often shy away from roles which aren’t a 100% match. We aim to build a diverse team and will strongly consider applicants who bring many of the requirements plus have other experiences which round out their qualifications.


MotherDuck is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. MotherDuck is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.


Compensation Range: $140K - $275K
