title: Data Analyst Airport Operations
description:
**Nice to know (you)**
----------------------

* We are looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for finding actionable insights in complex processes related to airport operations.
* Your insights will help the Airport Operations domain to get more value from data to improve process efficiency, while helping Product Owners to prototype novel data solutions.
* With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports.

**Connecting your world**
-------------------------


As Data Analyst Airport Operations you will generate actionable insights into the airport’s operational processes to optimize key metrics such as flight on-time performance, asset capacity optimization and passenger flows in the terminal.How you achieve results in this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you find a solution for every problem. You put your talents to work at:


* Exploring and analyzing the potential value of new datasets for our data solutions.
* Designing and implementing experiments along with the business to test hypotheses and evaluate the effectiveness of different concepts using data.
* Prototyping dashboards, reports, and other data visualization aids to support decision-making on a one-off basis or to help productionize them.
* Conducting exploratory data analyses to identify patterns and trends in large data sets.
* Applying storytelling and data visualization to convince your business stakeholders of your findings.


Through strategic use of AI, data, and applied data science, the DnA team identifies growth opportunities and drives innovations with new data products and services across Schiphol. The team is also responsible for ensuring high standards of data governance and quality, maintaining a centralized business intelligence function, and working closely with IT to develop a future-proof data infrastructure.


**You've got this**
-------------------


Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this by working with focus very purposefully to achieve results. Also, you are the talent who analyses problems, recognises patterns and reasons logically. The result? Insight and solutions. In addition, for this position you have:

* 3+ years of working in a data team, with meaningful experience in data analytics across multiple fields.
* Hbo/wo-level education in engineering, econometrics, sciences, business analytics, or related with a strong quantitative component.
* Experience in translating business requirements to data products or insights.
* The Ability to tell compelling stories with data and present outcomes effectively to stakeholders.
* Proficiency in analytical tools and programming languages, particularly Python and relevant libraries such as Pandas, Pyspark and Plotly or Matplotlib.
* Excellent communication skills, including fluency in English with Dutch fluency as a plus.


**You get this**
----------------

* € 4744 to € 6582 gross per month (Schaal 12).
* A 13th month (year-end bonus).
* The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.
* An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.


These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.


**About the Team**
------------------


The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.


**Choose your destination**
---------------------------


What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.


* Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner by sending a message to: erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl.
* For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
* For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, an AIVD security screening (VGB B civil aviation) is always part of the recruitment process.

**About Schiphol Group**
------------------------


With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:


* ... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.
* … there were approximately 442,000 aircraft movements to and from Schiphol Airport in 2023?
* ... as a Data Analyst you will be joining the business area Data and Analytics (DnA)?
company_description: Welkom in onze wereld.

title: Business Developer Basel Consumer Data Team
description:
Business Developer Basel Consumer Data Team**At a glance**
---------------


We are forming a new team within the Finance & Risk Data Domain dedicated to supply the Basel reporting team with the data they need to calculate the RWA.

  



Do you like variety in your job? Do you appreciate reliable data? Do you have good work ethic? Are you interested in data, programming and stakeholder management? Do you persevere in challenging and changing business environments, then ABN AMRO invites you to be part of the RWA Calculation Consumer Data team!

**Your job**
------------


As a Business Developer in the RWA Calculation Consumer Data team you are responsible for a variety of deliverables depending on the phase of implementation.


During project initiation you will translate business requirements into detailed data requirements. You will assess these requirements against the terms, definitions and logical data model of Finance and Risk. During the project execution you will analyse data and combine data from different sources to create meaningful integrated datasets, you will examine code from legacy systems and interpret processes to obtain valuable information for the business. You will perform data quality analyses and develop reports. You will work on documentation and have regular stakeholder alignment and team meetings where knowledge-sharing and transparency on progress is key. You will work closely with subject matter experts from Credit Risk, Basel reporting, Data Sourcing, Data Modelling and Data Platform.


And above all you will help mature the new team and the way of working within the team, and across teams, departments and grids.


**Working environment**
-----------------------


The Finance & Risk Data Domain is part of Finance & Risk Business Grids (F&RBG), and plays an active role for all the Finance and Risk departments. We employ 250+ international professionals with different backgrounds who are driven to bring data management within Finance & Risk to a structurally higher level. Our aim is to generate reliable finance & risk data on time. We do this by improving the data itself, data systems and data processes. We work with an Agile operating model. Our Finance and Risk Data Domain consists of 5 departments where the atmosphere is dynamic, open and informal.

**Your profile**
----------------


You actively contribute to the improvement of our team efforts. You strengthen the relationship with the stakeholders. You encourage teamwork. You are practical, have an analytical approach and take responsibility. Your ability to break down and interpret requirements on the one hand, and create future-proof data processes and datasets on the other hand in combination with impact assessments and stakeholder management is crucial for your success in this role.  

If you think this sounds like you, check to see if your profile matches the following:  

  

* You have strong communication skills, both verbal and written (English is required)
* You have successfully completed a higher professional education (Bsc.) or degree (Msc.)
* You have at least 5 years relevant working experience
* You have (demonstrable) experience in using SQL and Python. Experience in PySpark and Databricks is a pre.
* You have knowledge of at least one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* You have (demonstrable) experience with Data Modelling
* You have an understanding of data management best practices (e.g. DAMA)
* You have the ability to lead stakeholder engagement sessions and detail and challenge data requirements
* You have the knowledge of credit risk management in banking or financial institutions
* You have knowledge of Basel regulatory compliance requirements. Knowledge of RWA calculations is a pre.
**We are offering**
-------------------


A challenging environment offering you the possibility to develop yourself, both on contextual level in the Risk Management field of expertise, as well as managerial and leadership level. There are plenty of career opportunities to grow personally and professionally, which mainly depend on your own ambitions and interests. In addition, we offer:

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Interested?**
---------------


For more information contact Christél Rademan, Expert Lead RWA Calculation Consumer Data, via email: christel.rademan@nl.abnamro.com . We look forward to meeting you!

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij vragen**

* Goede communicatie vaardigheden
* Samenwerkingsgerichtheid
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Data Engineering Lead
description:
We are looking for an experienced professional to join our Data Engineer Team. As a Data Engineer Lead, you are responsible for all data landscape and data processes of our clients. We are Azure oriented, but also we love open source and clouds such as AWS and GCP.

**Who we are**
--------------



Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.


With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.  



  

**What we offer**
-----------------


* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.
* Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
* Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

  

  



**What you will do**
--------------------


* Lead, influence & implement the technical roadmap of our clients, in light of overall technology and architecture roadmaps.
* Be responsible for the Architecture, making sure that technical and non-technical components work together in the product to deliver the customer needs.
* Lead and Develop the digital development and operations using Python, Spark, RESTful API, and Microsoft Azure Cloud, ideally with some Data Insights experience.
* Steer the technical excellence of the application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, best practices, and standards.
* Coach and enable other product team members to deliver best-in-class products.
* Deliver data platforms, data insights and with the collaboration of the data science team – data products, such as recommendation systems, data lakes/hubs, data insights and dashboards.
* Lead project activities and will be responsible for the evaluation of business needs and objectives in collaboration with the project team and other stakeholders.

  



**What you’ll bring**
---------------------

* 5-8 years of experience in a similar role with experience in developing and deploying ETL solutions on Azure.
* Solid knowledge of data warehousing principles, concepts, and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Good understanding of common platforms and practices regarding digital development; Cloud-based setups, Advanced Analytics and computing environments, and GitHub (or similar) and CI/CD workflows.
* Experience in setting up automated testing frameworks including unit tests, integration tests.
* Understanding of modern cloud-based architecture (Lambda & Kappa architectures).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation, and data profiling skills.
* Experience in building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* Data governance experience.
* 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Azure: Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic, and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow, Kubernetes, Great expectations is a plus.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* Customer-centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
* Demonstrating true engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous.
* A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research. Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).

  

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Foundation Engineer
description:
Would you like to be part of our Foundation team and play a crucial role in managing and optimizing our data infrastructure?

  

#### **Over Stater**


**Wie zijn wij?**
=================


Wie is Stater eigenlijk? Wellicht heb je nog nooit van ons gehoord, dus wij leggen je graag uit wat we doen. Binnen stater ontwikkelen en leveren wij hypothecaire diensten en platformen voor externe geldgevers. Met onze producten en diensten beheren wij 40% van de hypotheken in Nederland. Werken bij ons is dus werken bij een organisatie die midden in de maatschappij staat met producten die veel Nederlandse gezinnen (in) raken. Onze klanten zijn o.a. grote Nederlandse banken en andere geldverstrekkers.


#### **Over deze functie**


**Wat ga je doen?**
===================


As a Foundation Engineer, you will be the expert in various technologies to help building and maintaining a robust foundation for our data operations. On a daily basis, you will design, develop, and maintain the data infrastructure using tools such as SQL and Hadoop. You will manage Hadoop ecosystem components like HDFS, Hive, and Spark for data storage, queries, and processing.


You will also be involved in developing and implementing data pipelines using Python/Pyspark for data processing and transformation. Additionally, you'll enjoy working with unstructured data and older data warehouse technologies such as Informatica Powercenter and SQL Server. Furthermore, you'll be responsible for version control and collaboration in various projects using Git.

  

#### **Skills**


**Naar wie zijn wij op zoek?**
==============================


You are an experienced data engineer and meticulous in your work. You appreciate a pragmatic approach, enjoy brainstorming, and take a proactive approach when engaging with relevant stakeholders. Additionally, you are constantly seeking opportunities for improvements and optimization.


Furthermore, you have:

* Minimum of 5 years of experience with SQL and proven experience working with complex databases.
* Deep knowledge of Hadoop ecosystem components, including HDFS, Hive, and Spark.
* Experience with Python/pyspark for data processing and analysis.
* Familiarity with Git for version control and collaboration in software development.
* Experience with PowerDesigner for designing and maintaining data models.
* Understanding of unstructured data and experience with older data warehouse technologies such as Informatica PowerCenter and SQL Server.


**Wat bieden we je aan?**
=========================


* Our platform helps a lot of customers to be innovative and successful. The top 3 of the Netherlands’ most successful mortgage providers are our clients.
* A lot of attention for work-life balance and hybrid working; 2 days a week at the office is the norm;
* A competitive gross month salary between €4.586,- and €5.733,- (schaal 21), depending on skills and experience;
* Personal development budget or possibility to buy extra days of leave; 18% of your gross salary;
* Possibility to develop yourself within an extensive training and certification catalogue;
* NS Business card or a travel allowance;
* A good pension scheme, we think it is important that you also benefit from your efforts with us later on.

  



**Heb je vragen over deze vacature?**
=====================================


Neem dan contact op met Lucienne de la Haije, Recruiter via 0031619619306 of lucienne.de.la.haije@stater.nl.

  

  

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
 Contact
**Gerelateerde vacatures**
==========================


### **Application Consultant AAH**


Technology
Als Applicatie Consultant maak je, namens Stater, onderdeel uit van een Business Development team van de grootste klant van Stater, ABN Amro Hypothek…


Amersfoort Fulltime €45.000 - €75.000
Solliciteer
### **Mender: BI en Datawarehouse specialist**


Technology
Jij bent een ervaren en enthousiaste BI en Datawarehouse specialist. De combinatie van het door ontwikkelen en beheren van het Big Data platform van …


Amersfoort Fulltime €45.000 - €75.000
Solliciteer

title: Data Engineer DataKitchen (datamart, python, pyspark, databricks)
description:
.

**Data Engineer**


Albert Heijn is a renowned supermarket chain that has been serving customers across the Netherlands for over 135 years. Founded in 1887 by Albert Heijn, the company has grown to become one of the most trusted and beloved grocery retailers in the country. With a commitment to quality, convenience, and customer satisfaction, Albert Heijn has become an integral part of the Dutch community's daily lives.


Albert Heijn is accelerating in becoming a Food and Tech Company. That is where AH Technology comes into the picture. With a focus on Data, Digital and Tech, we at Albert Heijn strive to deliver high quality products where technology plays an important role.

  

Part of AH Technology is the Data Differentiation Platform (DDP), where we support the Cloud Services and Data Management within Albert Heijn and deliver THE groundbreaking self-service data platform **suite**, called Thor, designed to empower Data Producers and Data Consumers.


With Thor, the process of data ingestion, transformation, and utilization becomes seamless, enabling users to unlock the full potential of their data while ensuring compliance with privacy regulations, including handling sensitive information like PII (Personally Identifiable Information).

 **So, what will be your job…**


We are looking for a Data Engineer who can help with the creation of our so called DataKitchen (*food and tech pun intended*) that is part of the Thor suite. The DataKitchen is an inhouse self-built framework for transforming conformed and cleansed data (*silver layer*) into DataMarts (*gold layer*) that are directly consumable for analysis and business use.


As a Data Engineer for the DataKitchen, you'll be the master chef behind the scenes, and be challenged with transforming and loading data as efficiently as possible and orchestrating all transformations. You'll also engage in stakeholder management, leveraging the latest cloud technologies to enhance efficiency and automate infrastructure deployment. Of course this all needs to be built in a secure manner and be in line with the data strategy to make DataKitchen as self-service as possible.


Currently we’re using the following tech stack to achieve our vision:

* GIT for version control
* Terraform for infrastructure deployment to Azure (we’re thinking about migrating to OpenTofu)
* GitHub actions for CI/CD
* Delta Lake as storage format
* Python for our codebase
* Databricks as our Lakehouse platform (Spark)
* PySpark for data transformations


But you won't be working alone. You will join a team of Data Engineers that are currently productionizing the first version of the DataKitchen. We expect to go into production by the end of the second quarter this year. However, to be able to scale, add additional features and support our DataKitchen, we need to grow our team. Ensuring we have a stable and mature team that can work towards the future, having our DataKitchen being used in all brands across Europe and maybe even beyond!


If you're ready to contribute your expertise to shape the future of data excellence across all brands in Europe and maybe even beyond, we invite you to join us on this exciting journey.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* *Work closely together with the DataKitchen Data Engineers in expanding the foundation of the* ***DataKitchen***
* Support the Product Owner with stakeholder management
* Train others in making right usage of the **DataKitchen**
* Ensure alignment with architecture and data strategy is there at all times
* Keep building the product in a scalable and cost effective manner
* Ensure the product meets all security guidelines
* Implement observability with proactive monitoring/alerting

 **Requirements**

* **5 or more** years of work experience as a Data Engineer
* Experience with Cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure)
* Experienced with Databricks
* **Experienced** with Python/SQL/PySpark
* Experienced in running bigger projects and scaling them
* Understanding concepts of **data transformation,** **data processing,** data modelling, orchestration and observability
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Lives in Netherlands and can work from Zaandam office minimum 2 days a week, more if required

 **What we offer**  

At Albert Heijn we aim to grow, and this is only possible if you grow along with us. As we work together to build our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):

* An annual salary up to 95k including holiday allowance and on top of that a flexible bonus. Depending on your level of seniority and experience
* A minimum of 20 days paid vacation, optionally 12.5 days extra. Do you want to take that extra time off, or would you rather convert the extra days into discounts or sell them for cash? You’re the end boss!
* Flexible working hours
* Access to a challenging training curriculum – AH Tech Academy
* An excellent pension plan where we as an employer contribute 6 times more than you as an employee
* A travel allowance or a NS-business card for traveling to and from Zaandam by train
* 10% staff discount on groceries in all Albert Heijn stores, to a maximum of €300 per year
* A free Mijn Albert Heijn Premium membership with many benefits
* A company laptop and telephone

 **Ready to contribute to our mission?**


Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Would you like to learn more first, before you apply to Albert Heijn? We’re happy to tell you everything about this vacancy! An assessment might be part of our selection process.


.

* ### **Solliciteren**


Stuur je sollicitatie in via deze website.
* ### **Gesprek**


Als je aan het profiel voldoet nodigen we je snel uit voor een gesprek in de winkel.
* ### **Mogelijkheden**


Samen bekijken we de mogelijkheden voor jou in de winkel zoals de verschillende werktijden en welke plek het beste bij je past.
* ### **Welkom!**


Zijn we allebei enthousiast? Dan kun je snel beginnen! Welkom.

### **Wat we vragen?**

* Een echte teamspeler
* Een positieve houding
* Een aanpakkersmentaliteit
* Passie voor data
* Sterke tech skills
* Goede analytische skills
* Oog voor detail
company_description: Albert Heijn is een supermarktketen in Nederland en Belgie. Met meer dan 125.000 collega’s vullen we elke avond ruim zes miljoen borden.

title: Data Engineer | Chatbot
description:
Data Engineer | Chatbot**At a glance**
---------------


We are looking for an enthusiastic colleague that will help us shape the future of Conversational AI at ABN AMRO in the role of an engineering who can maintain and improve our Conversational AI workflows by automating the data and ml processes used within the team to improve solutions like Chatbot Anna, Conversational IVR (Voicebot) and LLM-based Advisor Assist.

**Your job**
------------


Thousands of customers interact with ABN AMRO on a weekly basis. We want to make sure that these conversations are getting resolved in an effective and friction free manner.


Here at Team Advanced Conversational Engagement, part of the Customer Interaction Domain, we maintain and innovate on top of our conversational bot, Interactive voice response (IVR), and internal Advisor Assist tooling.


In the Cognition team we are responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and innovating our conversational solutions to ensure they meet evolving customer needs and industry standards.


Subjects you might be working on include: Setting up a medallion data architecture for analyses workflows, implementing pipelines to evaluate LLM prompts, implementing pipelines to evaluate classification algorithms, design how we store and manually annotate data etc.


Most recently we are in a middle of a massive migration from a major cloud based conversational AI platform to MS Copilot while attempting to empower our solutions with LLMs in a manner that is responsible, secure and reliable within the standards of ABN AMRO.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will be part of a multidisciplinary scrum team of data scientists, engineers and consultants.


In the extended team (~50 colleagues) you will be working alongside data engineers, user experience designers, content writers and front- and backend developers.

**Your profile**
----------------

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in a professional IT environment (you encountered GIT, CICD, OOP, unit testing, REST, SQL/NoSQL, docker);
* Able to effectively communicate (in written and spoken English) about your analyses and results;
* Strong programming skills with Python/Pyspark, focus on data (pre)processing and data handling;
* Databricks (delta live tables, compute, delta lake) or similar;
* Experience with a cloud environment (Azure);
* Pro-active, curious attitude and an excellent team player;
* Ability to independently take ownership over epics, plan and manage the epic and communicate with stakeholders;
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

### **Wij bieden**

* Een procesmatige aanpak

### **Wij vragen**

* Een creatief brein

title: Internship Business Inventory Analyst
description:
**Job Description:**

**Exciting Internship Opportunity: Business Inventory Analyst Intern**
----------------------------------------------------------------------

**Mars is a family-owned company with over a century of history, creating products and offering services for people and pets. With sales nearing $35 billion, we are a global powerhouse producing some of the world's most beloved brands across 180 countries, including M&M's®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, and FREEDENT®.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**About the Internship**


Join our Insights & Analytics team as a Business Inventory Analyst Intern. In this role, you will collaborate with business analysts and data scientists, working with data and creating visualizations to provide actionable insights for the business.

**What We Are Looking For**

* **Problem-Solving Skills**: Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
* **Technical Skills**: Proficiency in Python for data acquisition and Power BI for data visualization.
* **Communication Skills**: Excellent English communication abilities.
* **Education**: Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree.
* **Thesis Opportunity**: Allocate 3 days to the internship team and 2 days for your own research/thesis work.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Analytics Support**: Assist business analysts with periodic and ad-hoc analytics.
* **Tool Development**: Contribute to the development and maintenance of structural tooling.

 **What You Can Expect from Mars**

* **Professional Growth**: Develop your talents and expand your knowledge in a major FMCG company renowned for its world-class brands.
* **Compensation**: Enjoy an attractive internship compensation package.
* **Work Environment**: Experience a dynamic, ambitious, and fun work environment.

  

Apply now to kickstart your career with Mars!


Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Data Quality Analyst
Data Quality Analyst
Microsoft Fabric Data Engineer
description:
Belgium, Belgium/Estonia/Netherlands


DESCRIPTION
Sparkle: innovating data transformation



At Sparkle, we're more than BI consultants – we're architects of data-driven revolutions. Through strategy, cutting-edge engineering, and AI, we help Belgian businesses transform data into their most powerful asset. Join us and lead the way in harnessing the power of Microsoft Fabric to create future-ready data solutions.

  

Role overview  

We're seeking a dynamic Microsoft Fabric Data Engineer to craft cutting-edge data solutions utilizing the Microsoft Fabric platform. Dive into data integration, orchestration, and transformation to create the foundation for robust data-driven initiatives across diverse client projects.

  


Key responsibilities


* Lead the design and implementation of Microsoft Fabric-centric data platforms and data warehouses
* Develop and optimize ETL/ELT processes within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, effectively utilizing relevant Fabric solutions
* Ensure data integrity, quality, and governance throughout Microsoft Fabric environments
* Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business needs into actionable data solutions
* Troubleshoot and optimize existing Fabric implementations for enhanced performance

REQUIREMENTS
Who are you?


* Problem solver: you approach complex data challenges with a structured mindset. Breaking down problems and designing elegant solutions comes naturally
* Microsoft enthusiast: the evolving world of Microsoft data architecture excites you – staying current with new features and updates is something you enjoy
* Collaborative communicator: explaining technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences is second nature, keeping projects aligned with overarching business goals



Requirements  

Must haves:


* Microsoft Fabric expertise: demonstrated experience in developing and maintaining complex data pipelines with Microsoft Fabric
* Data Engineering foundations: solid experience in data warehousing, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling (dimensional, normalized)
* Azure knowhow: strong working knowledge of Azure services, especially Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, and Azure SQL Database
* Coding fluency: proficiency in SQL, Python, or other languages for data scripting, transformation, and automation
* Fluent in Dutch & English, French is a strong plus



Nice to haves:

  

* Big data background: familiarity with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, etc.)
* Databricks familiarity: experience with Databricks technologies
* Machine Learning exposure: understanding how data transformations support downstream ML workflows
* Data Visualization skills: ability to develop dashboards or reports using tools like Power BI enhances insights delivery



What we have to offer you when you become a Sparkleer:


* You'll have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, enhance your skills alongside experts in the field of data (and humor!), and contribute to solutions that make a real difference
* We're committed to your professional growth, offering a path to advance your career in a collaborative and supportive setting. Choose your apple tree buddy while your training budget lets you explore and expand your skills
* A salary package in line with your expertise, including a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalization and group insurance, and other gadgets that come extra being part of the Cronos Group
* Our team thrives on team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing & humor
* Hybrid way of working. No rules on coming to the office, so that means time for your children, partner or dog/cat/parrot/bunny/...



We are always looking for talent in Belgium, Estonia or The Netherlands. If you cannot find a suitable job opening, don’t hesitate to send your spontaneous application to hello@sparkle.consulting if you think you there will be a mutual match!

title: Data Analyst Airport Operations
description:
**Nice to know (you)**
----------------------

* We are looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for finding actionable insights in complex processes related to airport operations.
* Your insights will help the Airport Operations domain to get more value from data to improve process efficiency, while helping Product Owners to prototype novel data solutions.
* With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports.

**Connecting your world**
-------------------------


As Data Analyst Airport Operations you will generate actionable insights into the airport’s operational processes to optimize key metrics such as flight on-time performance, asset capacity optimization and passenger flows in the terminal.How you achieve results in this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you find a solution for every problem. You put your talents to work at:


* Exploring and analyzing the potential value of new datasets for our data solutions.
* Designing and implementing experiments along with the business to test hypotheses and evaluate the effectiveness of different concepts using data.
* Prototyping dashboards, reports, and other data visualization aids to support decision-making on a one-off basis or to help productionize them.
* Conducting exploratory data analyses to identify patterns and trends in large data sets.
* Applying storytelling and data visualization to convince your business stakeholders of your findings.


Through strategic use of AI, data, and applied data science, the DnA team identifies growth opportunities and drives innovations with new data products and services across Schiphol. The team is also responsible for ensuring high standards of data governance and quality, maintaining a centralized business intelligence function, and working closely with IT to develop a future-proof data infrastructure.


**You've got this**
-------------------


Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this by working with focus very purposefully to achieve results. Also, you are the talent who analyses problems, recognises patterns and reasons logically. The result? Insight and solutions. In addition, for this position you have:

* 3+ years of working in a data team, with meaningful experience in data analytics across multiple fields.
* Hbo/wo-level education in engineering, econometrics, sciences, business analytics, or related with a strong quantitative component.
* Experience in translating business requirements to data products or insights.
* The Ability to tell compelling stories with data and present outcomes effectively to stakeholders.
* Proficiency in analytical tools and programming languages, particularly Python and relevant libraries such as Pandas, Pyspark and Plotly or Matplotlib.
* Excellent communication skills, including fluency in English with Dutch fluency as a plus.


**You get this**
----------------

* € 4744 to € 6582 gross per month (Schaal 12).
* A 13th month (year-end bonus).
* The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.
* An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.


These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.


**About the Team**
------------------


The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.


**Choose your destination**
---------------------------


What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.


* Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner by sending a message to: erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl.
* For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
* For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, an AIVD security screening (VGB B civil aviation) is always part of the recruitment process.

**About Schiphol Group**
------------------------


With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:


* ... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.
* … there were approximately 442,000 aircraft movements to and from Schiphol Airport in 2023?
* ... as a Data Analyst you will be joining the business area Data and Analytics (DnA)?

title: Customer Insights and Growth/Customer Journey Expert - Personalization
description:
As a specialist in Customer Insights and Growth, you will be at the forefront of transforming data into business growth. Your key responsibilities include:


Bridging the gap between analytics and business impact

* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including digital sales, product development, and analytics to implement personalized customer journeys
* Create compelling storylines around growth opportunities and use these to engage and mobilize stakeholders to take action
* Inspire colleagues and foster a culture of data curiosity and learning


Entrepreneurial and proactively looking for opportunities

* Lead initiatives to enhance the effectiveness of customer communication channels (e.g., mobile, web, email, etc.)
* Utilize customer data and analytics to identify opportunities (e.g. customer segmentation, marketing campaigns, UX/product improvements, etc.) for personalization and customer engagement
* Develop and execute customer journey strategies focused on driving customer growth and retention
* Translate insights into concrete actions that drive marketing effectiveness and business impact
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in customer experience and personalization


Data-driven decision making

* Conduct research and analysis to understand customer behaviors, preferences, and pain points
* Design and implement A/B tests and experiments to optimize customer touchpoints and conversion rates
* Define relevant metrics, establish benchmarks, and ensure data accuracy
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer growth and engagement, and provide actionable recommendations for improvement
* Working with data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization tools (e.g., Python, SAS, SQL, Cognos)

**How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

* A bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)
* 3+ years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, data science, or related roles
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously
* Experience with performance marketing, CRM, and product analytics
* Great communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and influence stakeholders.
* Creative thinker with a customer-centric mindset and a passion for delivering exceptional results.
* Familiarity with financial services or banking/investment products is advantageous.

**Rewards and benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

 **About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

 **How to apply**


Ready to apply? Use the link below to upload your motivation letter and CV. If successful, you will be invited to two interviews so we can get to know you as a potential new colleague, and you can get to know us as a potential employer.

 **Questions?**


Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.


Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

title: Security Data Analyst
description:
As a Security Data Analyst, you will collect, analyze and interpret large volumes of security data, identify patterns and anomalies and create customized data-driven solutions, security reports & dashboards.


**Role and responsibilities**

In this role you are an expert data analysis. Using input from various security tools, you will be creating new holistic security reports & dashboards from scratch with the goal of tracking project progress and status, operational performance, key metrics, ad hoc analysis. Your role involves collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large volumes of security data including triggers from data leakage prevention tools, network traffic logs, etc. You will use your strong analytical skills & techniques to identify patterns and anomalies across ASML’s security landscape.


You will collaborate closely with other security & business teams to identify security threats, vulnerabilities, and risks and develop customized data-driven solutions to mitigate them. In short, your responsibilities will be:


* Design, develop, maintain & automate Spotfire and PowerBI dashboards and visualizations.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to design and develop metrics that enable success and change within their departments.
* Identify critical bottlenecks for reporting and analytics, and own projects to revamp the process for streamlining and automation.
* Monitor and govern the data, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
* Review existing data management processes to identify areas for improvement, and participate in continuous improvement initiatives.

**Experience and education**

Naturally, you will have a strong analytical background, operating with large data sets to identify trends and actionable insights. You have a data-driven approach to problem solving and are experienced in delivering dashboards from scratch, including requirement gathering, design, ETL, development and publishing. You are pro-active and self-motivated with the proven ability to drive results. Also, you possess strong attention to detail and have the ability to deliver high-quality work under tight deadlines.


* Strong analytical background, experienced in handling large data sets and a data-driven approach.
* Proficiency in programming languages like Python & data manipulation languages like SQL.
* 3+ years of experience working with security-related data, including collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large volumes of data from various sources.
* Experience working within an IT department; having worked in a CISO department is preferred.
* Expert knowledge on usage of data visualization software (Power BI or Spotfire) as well as advanced Excel skills
* Expert-level knowledge of Excel & PowerPoint required; macro programming experience preferred.

If you don’t meet the above mentioned requirements, and you still feel your profile is a great match with this job description, please apply and we’d like to get in touch.


*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability


**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .

title: Analytics Engineer L5, Title & Launch Management - EMEA
description:
Amsterdam, Netherlands
Data Science and Engineering
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with over 247 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across various genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and change their plans anytime.  

  

The goal of our Title & Launch Management Data Science and Engineering team is to enable operational and creative excellence in the distribution and promotion of our content. We collaborate closely with our partners in the Product Discovery & Promotion organization, and our work directly contributes to launching high-quality content on our service and helping our members discover content they will love. We conduct analyses, develop models, and build analytical tools to help our partners execute on these primary objectives.  

  

Europe is a significant center for our Studio and Creative Production teams. We are looking for a talented analytics engineer–to be based in our Amsterdam office–to join our growing European-based team. In this role, you would support the launch of our content and its discovery on our service, and become a trusted partner for regional Studio & Creative Production leadership. You will design and develop analytical products and insights that will power content launch operations at scale, while partnering with our world-class team of creative production practitioners and various cross-functional teams.  

Interested? Read more about the job description and qualifications below!**As a Senior Analytics Engineer in this space, you will:**
-----------------------------------------------------------

* Be a strategic partner for Creative Production teams: identify critical analytical problems and apply an entrepreneurial mindset to find innovative solutions with data.
* Drive the direction of your work, developing solutions that span from scrappy code and prototype tools to high-visibility dashboards and analyses for Creative Production leadership.
* Spearhead the creation of new metrics that impact decision-making across Creative Production.
* Collaborate with Data Engineers to source data from new systems and strengthen our foundational data models.
* Become a regional expert on all things Studio & Creative Production Data Science & Engineering, helping educate and connect regional offices to existing data solutions.
**You are:**
------------

* A strong communicator who can develop and deepen strong relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders. You have experience partnering closely with executive leadership, with a proven track record of influencing strategic decisions through data.
* Comfortable with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process. You connect the dots across business needs and independently drive projects forward.
* A senior analytics professional with extensive experience across data wrangling, analysis, reporting, and visualization.
* An expert in a data-oriented programming language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Scala, etc.) and intuitive dashboard/visualization design (e.g. Tableau).
* Proficient in ETL and data warehousing best practices and core statistics concepts (e.g., estimation, hypothesis testing)
* Adept at working across different cultures on a globally distributed team, with core working hours in the Central European and GMT time zones.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

title: Data Engineering Lead
description:
We are looking for an experienced professional to join our Data Engineer Team. As a Data Engineer Lead, you are responsible for all data landscape and data processes of our clients. We are Azure oriented, but also we love open source and clouds such as AWS and GCP.

**Who we are**
--------------



Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.


With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.  



  

**What we offer**
-----------------


* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.
* Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
* Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

  

  



**What you will do**
--------------------


* Lead, influence & implement the technical roadmap of our clients, in light of overall technology and architecture roadmaps.
* Be responsible for the Architecture, making sure that technical and non-technical components work together in the product to deliver the customer needs.
* Lead and Develop the digital development and operations using Python, Spark, RESTful API, and Microsoft Azure Cloud, ideally with some Data Insights experience.
* Steer the technical excellence of the application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, best practices, and standards.
* Coach and enable other product team members to deliver best-in-class products.
* Deliver data platforms, data insights and with the collaboration of the data science team – data products, such as recommendation systems, data lakes/hubs, data insights and dashboards.
* Lead project activities and will be responsible for the evaluation of business needs and objectives in collaboration with the project team and other stakeholders.

  



**What you’ll bring**
---------------------

* 5-8 years of experience in a similar role with experience in developing and deploying ETL solutions on Azure.
* Solid knowledge of data warehousing principles, concepts, and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Good understanding of common platforms and practices regarding digital development; Cloud-based setups, Advanced Analytics and computing environments, and GitHub (or similar) and CI/CD workflows.
* Experience in setting up automated testing frameworks including unit tests, integration tests.
* Understanding of modern cloud-based architecture (Lambda & Kappa architectures).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation, and data profiling skills.
* Experience in building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* Data governance experience.
* 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Azure: Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic, and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow, Kubernetes, Great expectations is a plus.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* Customer-centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
* Demonstrating true engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous.
* A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research. Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).

  

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Computer Science Internship: Dashboard for Requirements Engineering
description:
**Job ID:** J-00298017
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------

Are you a bachelor's student in Computer Science and looking for an internship? Do you have affinity towards requirements engineering/management and would like to apply it on industrial problems? Then this internship might be for you!


**Background information**
--------------------------

Within ASML, the sector Development & Engineering (D&E) is responsible for the specification and the development of ASML products. This exciting position is available in the Laser Light Generation group, that is part of the Embedded SW EUV department of ASML's business function Development & Engineering – Software.


**Your assignment**
-------------------

You will define, implement and integrate a tool for our requirements engineering process to:


1. Analyze the current status of the implementation of component interfaces;


* Evaluate interface implementation completeness and adherence to specification (requirements cross-check);
* Evaluate interface functionality test-coverage;

2. Analyze requirements database


* Verify that documentation is up-to-date with the software implementation
* Verify the completeness of the requirements database

3. Develop a graphical reporting tool to visualize analysis results


* Design appropriate data visualization strategies to effectively convey the analysis results
* Implement a visually attractive and interactive report
* The tool should be capable of handling large amounts of data

4. Integrate Analysis and Reporting tool into build environment


* Integrate the tooling into our build and/or testing pipelines
* Generate the analysis and report for each released software baseline
* Make reports available for users along with the released software

**Your profile**
----------------

To be a great match for this role, ideally you are:


* Bachelor's student in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related disciplines.
* Familiar with aspects of requirements engineering/management.
* Knowledge in Python programming and C/C++.
* A team player, a self-starter, complimented with can-do mentality.
* Fluent in English.

Other requirements you need to meet:


* This assignment could be an apprentice as well as graduation project, for minimum 5 months or more starting ASAP.
* Working for minimum 32 hours per week, with a maximum of 40.
* You are enrolled at a higher education institution for the entire duration of the internship.
* You need to be located in the Netherlands to be perform your internship. In case you ‘re currently living/studying outside of the Netherlands, please include in your CV/motivation letter willingness to relocate.

*This position requires access to U.S. controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations. Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such U.S. controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access U.S. controlled technology.*

**Other information**
---------------------

Change the world – one nanometer at a time
  

Become an intern at a Dutch company that’s a global industry leader. You’ll gain valuable experience in a highly innovative environment – one that sparks your imagination and creativity. In addition to a monthly internship allowance of maximum €600 (plus a housing and free public transport), you’ll get practical guidance from experts in the field and the chance to work in and experience a dynamic team environment.  




**ASML: be part of progress**
------------------------------

ASML is a high-tech company headquartered in the Netherlands. We manufacture the complex lithography machines that chipmakers use to produce integrated circuits, or computer chips. What we do is at the heart of all the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained, and connected. Every day, you use electronics that simply wouldn’t exist without our machines.
  

  

Behind ASML’s innovations are engineers who think ahead. The people who work at our company include some of the most creative minds in physics, electrical engineering, mathematics, chemistry, mechatronics, optics, mechanical engineering, and computer science and software engineering.
  

  

We believe we can always do better. We believe the winning idea can come from anyone. We love what we do – not because it’s easy, but because it’s hard.
  

  

Students: getting ready for real-world R&D
  

We’re a global team of about 39,000 people of 140 different nationalities and counting. Headquartered in Europe’s top tech hub, the Brainport Eindhoven region in the Netherlands, our operations are spread across Europe, Asia and the US.
  

  

In such an environment, your colleagues may be sitting next door, or they could be thousands of kilometers away in a different country – or even working for a different company.
  

  

An internship at ASML is the opportunity to get to know not only the world of industrial-strength R&D, but yourself – you’ll discover just what excites you most. Will you design a part of the machine, or make sure it gets built to the tightest possible specifications? Will you write software that drives the system to its best performance, or work side-by-side with the engineers of our customers in a fab, optimizing a system to the requirements of the customer?


*How will you be part of progress?*

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .

title: Senior Scientist - Uber Rides and Eats
description:
**About the Role**  

  

Our mission is create the best platform for our drivers. We are focusing on building a personalized experience that empowers earners to earn and progress effectively at Uber. We are looking for an experienced candidate who has the ability to break complex problems down into executable parts for testing, and is eager to take on new challenges.
  

  

**What you will need*** Propose, design, and analyze large scale online experiments
* Define and implement metrics to measure product performance
* Present findings to business and executive audiences
* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to implement ideas and plan future roadmaps
* Advanced understanding of statistics, causal inference, and machine learning
* 5+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Experience working with large scale data sets using technologies like Hive, Presto, and Spark

**Basic Qualifications*** Ph.D., MS or Bachelors degree in Economics, Operations Research, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
* If Ph.D or M.S. degree, a minimum of 2+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of machine learning, statistics, optimization, economics, and analytics
* Knowledge of experimental design and analysis
* Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, and model development
* Ability to use a language like Python or R to work efficiently at scale with large data sets
* Proficiency in technologies in one or more of the following: SQL, Spark, Hadoop

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high-quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 18 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy, and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: Green Chef, EveryPlate, Chefs Plate, Factor\_, and Youfoodz.
HelloFresh has been recognized as the #7 Best Place to Work in the list of Multinationals 2023 by Great Place to Work Netherlands! Check out our amazing team and office here and learn more on our socials On LinkedIn and Instagram! Ready to join our team?



 This is how you’ll change the way people eat forever  

  

We are looking for a [Marketing Analyst] for our ambitious Marketing Analytics team where you’ll take a role in advising our marketing teams with key insights through data analysis on multiple levels (customers, campaigns, channels, brands) focusing on key areas for the company (Growth, Reactivation, Incrementality, Discounts). You will be in charge of data collection, treatment, analysis, presenting data and turning them into actionable recommendations to a large variety of teams and stakeholders within the company.



 This is how you’ll make an impact


* Provide cracking insights into customer acquisition and reactivation, looking for improvement opportunities to optimize marketing campaigns, channel targeting, efficiency, etc.
* Work closely with stakeholders from our Growth channels and other (Marketing) teams, and translate their business questions into structured and meaningful analytics - combining business and technical understanding
* Run in-depth analyses, create dashboards and reports, organize and evaluate AB tests, provide ad-hoc insights, etc.
* Carry out complex in-depth analyses to understand the impact of (e.g.) our price & discount set-up on customer dynamics and economics (conversion, retention, profit contribution, …) and identify and validate opportunities to improve
* Use various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
* Discuss the results of your work with stakeholders of various seniority, including the domain leads of our Marketing teams
* Take responsibility of own projects, but also collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts
* Support our recently launched and strongly growing brand Green Chef
* Contribute to the broader HelloFresh Benelux’ Analytics capabilities through knowledge sharing and training


 These are the ingredients you’ll bring to the team


* At least 3+ years experience in a similar role, driving business impact based on Data and Analytics. Experience with marketing metrics and/or in a consumer-facing business is a plus. E.g. in a fast-growing start-up / scale-up, consulting company or a data-driven corporate
* A quantitative and analytical mindset and skillset. More specifically, you have strong SQL skills. You have experience with statistical analyses (e.g. regression modeling, AB testing). You also have experience in visualization tools(e.g. Tableau, Looker, Google Studio).
* Experience with other programming languages such as Python and R is a plus.
* Strong business sense: ability to build a “bridge” between business needs and your analysis (problem & analysis structuring), and between your analysis result and business implications (recommendation definition, data visualization, storylining)
* You don’t shy away from a challenge and have a hands-on can-do attitude. You can work independently. You communicate clearly and are able to perform in a fast-paced and continuously changing work environment, interacting and creating support with a variety of local and Global stakeholders.


 This is our recipe


* Freedom to initiate, execute and implement your own ideas
* The opportunity to engage and collaborate with our colleagues across the globe
* Participation in the HelloFresh Benelux Business Analytics L&D community, where you will develop yourself through training (hard skills & problem solving), support and knowledge sharing with other analysts
* Other learning and development opportunities including a personal development budget
* 24 holidays per year, plus 1 day per additional year of work
* A hybrid work setup, with a budget to help set up your home office
* Flexibility to work abroad
* Reimbursement of travel expenses to the office
* A discount on your weekly HelloFresh and/or Green Chef box
* Our FreshEnergy program including bootcamp, yoga, boxing, Headspace subscription, a collaboration with OpenUp for your mental wellbeing, webinars and other events
* Multiple ways of getting to a work-related appointment, for example by using our company cars or a MyWheels car
* Discount on your ClassPass subscription, and a discount for your gym membership via High Five Fitness Network.
* Discount on your additional health insurance through Zilveren Kruis
* Healthy lunches, fruit and snacks in the office
* Monthly pension scheme


 Grow your career at HelloFresh



A career at HelloFresh is an opportunity to make an impact in a world-leading meal-kit company. Through our Learning Never Stops core value, we empower you to take your career development to your highest potential…but we don’t just want to say it, we want to show it too.



Check out some amazing growth stories here:


* Joran van der Hel’s journey from driver to Ground Operations Manager
* Valerie Blank’s journey from Junior Sampling Coordinator to Team Lead of Product Marketing


 Hungry for more?


* Apply with your CV and a strong motivation to join us (In English please)
* If we see a match, you’ll have a video call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team.
* Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job.
* Next up is an in-person interview (if possible) with the hiring team to get to know you better and dive into more detail of your skills and how you are going to make an impact.
* Lastly you’ll have a conversation with people from our Associate Director Strategy & Analytics BLX



About HelloFresh  

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!  

  

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.  

  

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.  

  

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn.  

  

*HelloFresh is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities. If you need an accommodation during the application process, please reach out to us at:*  

* *Europe:**EUaccommodations@hellofresh.com**.*
* *APAC:* *APACaccommodations@hellofresh.com*
